alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cleburne; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:35PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Randolph, central Talladega, southeastern Calhoun, Cleburne and northeastern Clay Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1135 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mars Hills to 6 miles east of Oxford Lake to near Pell City. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Heflin, West End-Cobb Town, Lincoln, Munford, Hobson City, Ranburne, Fruithurst, Waldo, Edwardsville, Woodland, Talladega Superspeedway, Corinth, Talladega Municipal Airport, Grant Town, Muscadine, Abernathy and Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.
